title: Teenager is killed in a freak athletics accident after being struck on the head by a 6lb hammer
text:
A teenager participating in an athletics competition was killed after being struck on the head by a 6lb hammer.

Apheel Johnson was hit with the heavy iron ball by a fellow competitor at the event in India.

The 17-year-old was working at the 63rd Kerala State Junior Athletics Championship at the Municipal Stadium in Pala on October 4.

After he was hit the youngster was pictured being carried off the athletics field and blood was pouring down his face.

Apheel Johnson (pictured above) was rushed off the athletics ground after being hit in the head

The teenager (pictured above) had been working as a marker at the event which was held on October 4

After the accident, he was taken to a local hospital, but died from his injuries on Monday at around 4.10pm.

He had been in the critical care unit of the hospital after undergoing an emergency surgery, Times of India reported.

The primary cause of death was a severe brain injury.

He was the marker at the javelin throw event in the boy’s under-18s category and had measured a javelin throw.

Apheel (pictured above) didn't get out of the way in time and was hit by the iron ball

Apheel had been trying to return to the safety zone when the incident occurred.

Officials at the competition had shouted at Apheel to get out of the way of the hammer throw – however, he didn’t have enough time to react.

He was hit by the iron ball by a girl who had been competing in the U-18s event.

Apheel tried to duck but the ball hit him on the head, he then collapsed to the ground in pain.

A report filed by the Pala RDO Anil Oomen has since confirmed that officials at the event had not been adhering to official safety guidelines.
description: WARNING GRAPHIC CONTENT: Apheel Johnson was hit with the heavy iron ball by a fellow competitor at the event in India.
